Header: Japanese Emperor Akihito resting due to cerebral anemia
Content: Japanese Emperor Akihito cancelled his public duties after suffering dizziness and nausea due to cerebral anemia, a condition caused by insufficient blood flow to the brain. Akihito, 84, who has spent much of his nearly three decades on the throne seeking to heal the wounds of war, is set to step down on April 30 next year in the first abdication by a Japanese emperor in nearly two centuries. The emperor will be monitored while he rests at the Imperial Palace in Tokyo.
